subject: Fwd: Black Pro Pedals
description_text:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Sean Eay <sean.eay@gmail.com>
Date: Sat, Dec 6, 2025 at 5:59 PM
Subject: Black Pro Pedals
To: <service@simsonn.com>


Hello Team, I recently purchased the Simsonn Pro Plus Pedal Set in Black on
Amazon. The throttle and brake both work great and I’m very happy with the
product. However, the bolt lock for the brake pedal travel seems to be
stuck, and I’m unable to loosen or remove it.

I would prefer not to return the entire unit. Instead, I wanted to check if
it’s possible to purchase a replacement rod, or if you recommend sending
the product back for service. I’ve attached an image for reference. The red
circle shows the screw that is stuck, and the yellow circle indicates the
part I am hoping to replace or buy.

Please let me know the best way to proceed. Thank you.

conversations.body_text: Hi Sean Eay,     Please refer to the two arrows I marked. Use a flathead screwdriver to hold the screw on the opposite side, then use a wrench to loosen the screw. Additionally, if you wish to replace the damping, follow the manual: hook the bracket and lift it upward to easily remove the damping.

Thank you for replying, its still stuck the bottom  when i used the
flathead screw started to bend the flathead grove i dont feel comfortable
doing it again as it might damage. Is there a way that i could just buy a
new one?

On Tue, Dec 16, 2025 at 6:43 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Sean Eay,     If you would like to change to a different color damper, please follow the steps below to replace it.

Hello its not the damper that I wanted to replace the rod itself that holds
the  dampers, the screw for the travel thing is stuck
